subject: Politics
title: Identity Politics
description: A short lesson to help you apply Identity Politics.

hook.text: Identity politics says your race, gender, or sexuality shapes your political experience. Critics call it divisive.

buildup.text: The idea is that marginalized groups face unique injustices that mainstream politics ignores.

discovery.text: The civil rights and feminist movements pioneered identity politics. They demanded recognition and equal treatment.

twist.text: Critics on both left and right object. The left says it divides workers. The right says it threatens national unity.

climax.text: Identity politics dominates modern culture wars. It shapes elections, media, and daily conversation.

punchline.text: Identity shapes experience. The question is how much politics should too.

quiz.question: What is the core claim of identity politics?
options: Marginalized groups face unique injustices mainstream politics ignores
All people have identical political experiences
Only economic class matters in politics
